page.title: 02HOBY FIELD STUDY CENTRE
page.content:
The field centre used to be the old Victorian village school. Now schools use it to study the village of Hoby.
The centre is owned by Leicestershire County Council but Mr. Graham Sparrow is the teacher in charge there.There is one large room only with girls & boys toilets off this. In the centre there is a lot of equipment including magnifying glasses,microscopes, pond dipping equipment & lots of books & worksheets.
The schools that use Hoby field centre study such things as pond & river life, trees, flowers, plants, wildlife,the history of the church & church yard,the houses, farming & the village.
